Package xxl.core.collections.containers.io

Provides some containers that are able to store their blocks on disk.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlockFileContainer
    This class provides a container that is able to store blocks in a file.
    BufferedContainer
    This class wraps a container by buffering its elements in a given buffer.
    ConverterContainer
    This class provides a container that stores a set of converted elements.
    ConverterContainerRawAccess
    This class extends a ConverterContainer with functionality for flushing arrays of blocks.
    MultiBlockContainer
    This class provides a container that is able to store logical blocks whose size is an arbitrary.
    RawAccessContainer
    This class provides a container that is able to store blocks directly on a raw access.

Package xxl.core.collections.containers.io Description

Provides some containers that are able to store their blocks on disk. In general, containers are objects that deal with the management of a set of objects. In contrast to the Java collection framework, any collection of this framework supports a close method. This method releases any system resources associated with the collection and is very important for collections using external resources like files or JDBC resources.
